effect:
**Diao Chan Lineage**

**On Enter**: Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put a **wither** counter on each of them.

Whenever a non-token object an opponent controls is destroyed, you may banish it. If you do, that opponent **summons** a Flowerbud token.
effect_raw:
Diao Chan Lineage

On Enter: Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put a wither counter on each of them.

Whenever a non-token object an opponent controls is destroyed, you may banish it. If you do, that opponent summons a Flowerbud token.
name: Diao Chan, Idyll Corsage

rule.description: The destroyed object must be banished by Diao Chan's trigger from the graveyard to have its controller summon a Flowerbud token. A Flowerbud token will not be summoned on the destruction of a regalia, which never exists in the graveyard. In addition, if the destroyed card was banished before Diao Chan's trigger resolves, because this trigger's effect did not do the banishing, a Flowerbud token will also not be summoned.
Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.

effect_html: Diao Chan LineageOn Enter: Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put a wither counter on each of them.Whenever a non-token object an opponent controls is destroyed, you may banish it. If you do, that opponent summons a Flowerbud token.

rule.description: The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.
Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

rule.description: Siegeable domains are not considered units. This means that being destroyed is not considered a death, and on kill and on death abilities won't trigger. Effects that target units cannot target Siegeable domains without additional typing.
In the Standard format, players skip their recollection phase on their first turn of the game. This means that Xuchang won't trigger.
On hit abilities still trigger when dealing combat damage to a Siegeable domain.
As of the release of HVN1E, the cleave keyword has been changed to attack all attackable objects rather than only units. This includes Siegeable domains.
As of the release of HVN1E, the taunt keyword has been changed to block attack targeting from all attackable objects without taunt rather than only units. This includes Siegeable domains.

effect: At the beginning of your recollection phase, put a **wither** counter on target non-champion non-token object you control. *(At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with **wither** counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each **wither** counter on it, then remove **wither** counters.)*
effect_raw: At the beginning of your recollection phase, put a wither counter on target non-champion non-token object you control. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)
name: Nightshade

rule.description: Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.

effect_html: At the beginning of your recollection phase, put a wither counter on target non-champion non-token object you control. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay 1for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)
